data.title: Card File
data.text:
HOME

Warren County Iowa GAR Card File - F

FALLIS, John M., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Occupation: Blacksmith, Place of Birth: Switzerland County, Indiana, Date of Death: Oct 10, 1900, Place of Birth: Indianola, Iowa, Place of Burial: I.O.O.F. Cemetery, Lincoln Township, Warren County, Iowa, Father: James A. Fallis, Mother: Mary Parr, Wife: Mary J. Tharp, Children: Emily Lewis, Elizabeth, David W., Anna, Allen F., Eva G., John T.

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 34th Iowa Infantry, Company C., enlisted Aug 13, 1862, age 30, residence Indianola, born Indiana. Discharged for disability April 9, 1863, Chicago, Illinois

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Roster of Iowa Soldiers: Follis, John M., Ex-Soldiers Living in Iowa 1886: Fallis, John M. â residence Indianola, Application Paper Post 116, age 51, March 8, 1884

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Indianola Post 116, joined March 8, 1884, discharged Oct 2, 1886

FARLEY, Mathew, GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Date of Death: May 4, 1922, Place of Death: Carlisle, Iowa, age 75, Place of Burial: Carlisle Cemetery, Carlisle, Allen Township, Father: Nathan Farley, Mother: Emma Harner, Wife: Elizabeth Ellison, Children: Edward, Mary L., Guy, Laura

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 15th Iowa Infantry, Company G, enlisted and mustered March 22, 1864, age 18, residence Polk County, Iowa, nativity Iowa.Â Mustered out July 24, 1865, Louisville, Kentucky

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â History of Warren County Iowa, Roster of Iowa Soldiers: Farley, Matt, Ex-Soldiers Living in Iowa 1886: Farley, Mathew â residence Carlisle

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Carlisle Post 425

FEAR, William H., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Occupation: Farmer, Cool, Iowa, Place of Birth: Maryland, Date of Death: July 31, 1915, age 73, Place of Burial: Shaver Cemetery, Liberty Township, Warren County, Iowa

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 1st West Virginia Cavalry, Company G (typed A, but crossed out and replace with G), served July 18, 1861 â Sept 20, 1864.Â Name borne Feor.Â

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Ex-Soldiers Living in Iowa 1886: (W.H.) â Company G, - residence Cool, Iowa

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Descriptive Book of Post 116 #1st; enlisted July 18, 1861.Â Mustered out Oct 29, 1864, Company A, 1st West Virginia Cavalry

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Application Paper Post 116 â same information as Descriptive Book

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Indianola Post 116, joined 1891, age 49, suspended 1892, dropped 1893

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â St. Charles Post 158, joined 1913

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â

FELTON, John B., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Residence: New Virginia, Iowa, Occupation: Farmer, Date of Birth: 1844 or 1845, Place of Birth: West Virginia, Date of Death: Jan 31, 1903, Place of Death, Indianola, Iowa, Place of Burial: New Virginia Cemetery, New Virginia, Iowa, Virginia Township, Warren County, Iowa, Father: John Felton, Mother: Martha A., Wife: Rhoda Jones, Children: John H. â residence Indianola, Iowa

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 34th Iowa Infantry, Company K, transferred to 34th Iowa Consolidated Battalion, Company A, transferred to 34/38 Consolidated Battalion, Company A, enlisted Jan 4, 1864, age 18, discharged Aug 25, 1865

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Roster Iowa Soldiers: Company K, 34th Iowa Infantry: Fulton, John B (error for Felton), age 18, residence Warren County, nativity Virginia, enlisted Jan 4th, mustered Feb 1, 1864, transferred to Company A, 34th Consolidated Battalion Nov 12, 1864, Shown in Company A, 34th Consolidated: Felton, John B., enlisted and mustered Jan 4, 1864, Transferred to Company A., 34/38 Consolidated Jan 1, 1865 â mustered out Aug 15, 1865, Houston, Texas, Post 444 Descriptive Book: Felton, John B., Post 51 (later 302) Descriptive Book, Ex-Soldiers Living in Iowa 1886: Felton, John B., Company A, 34th Iowa, residence - New Virginia, Resolutions upon death by Post 116, Jan.31, 1903

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â From Resolutions of Respect Post 116, Jan 31, 1903

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â New Virginia Post 51 (later Post 302), joined March 17, 1884

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â New Virginia Post 444, joined Nov 1, 1887

Indianola Post 116

FELTON, William H., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Residence: New Virginia, Iowa, Occupation: Teamster and Laborer, New Virginia, Iowa, Birth Date: 1840 or 1841, Birth Place; West Virginia, Death Date: Jan 21, 1905, Death Place: New Virginia, Iowa, Burial Place: New Virginia Cemetery, Virginia Twp, Warren Co. Iowa, Father: John Felton, Mother; Margaret Wootring, Wife: Harriet Stacy

War Record:

Private, 10th Iowa Infantry, Company G, Enlisted Aug 29, 1861, age 21, residence New Virginia, wounded severely thigh May 26, 1862, Farmington, Mississippi, wounded in both thighs, Corinth, Miss., discharged April 4, 1863

Sources:

Roster Iowa Soldiers: Felton, Wm. H, Post 444 Descriptive Book: Felton, W.B., Post 51 Descriptive Book, born 1841, Ex-Soldiers Living in Iowa 1886: Fulton â Residence â New Virginia, Sent questionnaire to Mrs. Ella Felton of New Virginia, May 6, 1953

Post Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â New Virginia Post 51 (later Post 302) joined 1884

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â New Virginia Post 444, joined Nov.1, 1887, held office of Adjutant General in Post 444 in 1887

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â

FENTON, Otis J., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Residence: Palmyra, Warren County, Iowa, 1886, 1904, Date of Death: Nov 5, 1903, Place of Death: Palmyra, Iowa, Place of Burial: Palmyra Cemetery, Palmyra Township, Warren County, Iowa, Father: James Fenton, Mother: Rose Welch, Wife: Lucretia P. Hinman, Children: Charley Glenn Fenton

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Lieutenant in 12th Michigan Infantry, Company H, enlisted Feb 16, 1862 in Company C, 12th Michigan Infantry at Niles, for 3 years.Â Mustered Feb 17, 1862.Â Reenlisted as Corporal Feb 18, 1864, at Little Rock, Arkansas.Â Mustered Feb 18, 1864, Sergeant April 8, 1864.Â Discharged to accept promotion March 4, 1865.Â Commissioned 2nd Lieutenant, Company D, April 15, 1865.Â Mustered May 5, 1865.Â Commissioned 1st Lieutenant Aug 26, 1865.Â Mustered out at Camden, Arkansas Feb 15, 1866

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 30th Annual Encampment: Fenton, Otis J. â Lieutenant, Record of Michigan Volunteers: (Otis, J.) Company C, Graves Registration: died Dec 14, 1904, age 64

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Veteran Pensioned SC 232 518, Nov 18, 1895, died Nov 5, 1903, Des Moines Agency

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Record of Michigan Volunteers

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Pension file shows wife died Aug 3, 1896, one child, Glenn C. born March 9, 1867.Â In 1859 veteran resided at Terre Coupee, St. Jo County, Indiana where he had resided since 1846, worked for Jas. Carskaddon on farm 1859-1860, drove team hauling logs until April 2, 1860 when contracted to chop wood and clear land 18 miles north east of Terre Coupee in Berrien County, Michigan.Â Moved after discharge to Warren County, Iowa.Â In Oct 1869 owned farm 40 acres in La Porte County, Indiana 4 miles west of Terre Coupee, took trip by wagon to southern Minnesota, returned Spring 1873, then went to Kansas, stayed about 2 months, received some benefit, in 1874 moved to Palmyra on a farm 1 Â½ miles from it â Palmyra 1877-Aug 1880.Â Statement of 1880.

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Hartford Post 169, joined June 8, 1883, age 42, reinstated 1900

FIRMAN, Horace, GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Occupation: Shoemaker, Place of Birth: Warsaw, New York

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 3rd New York Cavalry, Company H, enlisted Aug 20 or 27, 1861 at Rochester by Captain E.C. Marshall for 3 years, age 24, mustered out Aug 19, 1864.

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Post 309 Descriptive Book: 3rd New York Cavalry, overwritten Pennsylvania (Not found in Pennsylvania Cavalry), New York Men in Civil War: Fuman, Horace, Private Company H, 3rd New York Cavalry

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Lacona Post 309, joined Aug 1, 1884, age 47, discharged Nov 20, 1885, reinstated Aug 15, 1887, transferred Dec 24, 1887

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â In Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, Sept. 1887, stating Post there would not accept him by transfer â wishing to be reinstated in old Post at Lacona

FISHER, Ephraim N., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Date of Death: Dec 22, 1929, Place of Death: Carlisle, Iowa, age 91, Place of Burial: Carlisle Cemetery, Carlisle, Allen Township, Warren County, Iowa, Father: Alfred A. Fisher, Mother: Sarah Mayer, Wife: Jane Black, Children: Sullivan (married Clarissa)

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 10th Iowa Infantry, Company B, enlisted Aug 23, 1861 and mustered Sept 6, 1861, age 23, residence Carlisle, born Indiana. Discharged March 6, 1862, Birdâs Point, Missouri

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Roster Iowa Soldiers: Fisher, Ephraim N., History of Warren County, Ex-Soldiers Living in Iowa 1886: Fisher, Ephraim â residence Carlisle, Graves Registration carries as Ephraim A.

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Clarissa (widow of Sullivan Fisher, son of Ephraim N. living in Carlisle â Oct 1944, South East part of town

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Hartford Post 169, joined Oct 27, 1883, age 45

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Carlisle Post 425, joined 1891

FISHER, John T., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Occupation: Farmer, Place of Birth: Brown County, Ohio

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Sergeant in 44th Indiana Infantry, Company H, enlisted and mustered Nov 22, 1861, residence Hawpatch, Indiana, discharged Jan 12, 1864 at Nashville, Tennessee by reason of veteranizing.Â Re-enlisted Jan 12, 1864. Mustered out at Chattanooga, Tennessee Sept 17, 1865, Close of War

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Ex-Soldiers Living in Iowa 1886: (J.T.) â Company H â residence Greencastle, Adjutant Generalâs Report of Indiana: Private Company H, G.A.R. Muster Roll: had Company B, Application Paper, Post 116, Application Paper says number on Post Roll is 230

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Indianola Post 116, joined Mar 4, 1899, age 58

FISHER, Levi, GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Occupation: Merchant, Date of Birth: Feb 6, 1823, Date of Death: Mar 20, 1895, Place of Death: Warren County, Iowa, Place of Burial: Cochran Cemetery, White Breast Township, Warren County, Iowa, Father: James Fisher, Mother: Almeda Clay, Wife: Matilka Laymen, Children: Levi Jr.

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 1st Lieutenant in 19th Iowa Infantry, Company F, appointed 1st Lieutenant July 19, 1862, mustered Aug 21, 1862, age 39, residence Wapello County, Iowa, nativity Pennsylvania.Â Promoted Captain June 7, 1863, Atchafalaya, Louisiana. Resigned June 26, 1865

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Prisoner: Morganza, Louisiana, Oct 10, 1863 to July 28, 1864

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Roster of Iowa Soldiers: Levi, Ex-Soldiers Living in Iowa 1886: Lewis â Captain â residence Lacona, Grave Registration lists death date as Sept 18, 1895

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Lacona Post 309, joined April 12, 1884

FORTNEY, Silas M., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Occupation: Stone Mason, and Farmer, Indianola, Iowa, Place of Birth: Preston, West Virginia, Wife: Anna M. born West Virginia, Children: Mae M., Bruce T., Nellie B.

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 4th West Virginia Cavalry, Company B, enlisted age 22, July 23, 1863 Independence, West Virginia, mustered July 21, 1863 Wheeling West Virginia

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in Lieutenant Morganâs Company 4th Regiment West Virginia Cavalry or Company B, 4th West Virginia Cavalry, 6 months (63-4)

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Enlisted July 1863, mustered out March 7 or 20, 1864 at Wheeling, West Virginia, expiration of term (9 months)

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Application Paper Post 116 â age 51 (Dec 5, 1891), Adjutant Generalâs War Department File April 1948, Post 116 Descriptive Book #189, S.M. Fortney

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Iowa Census 1895 Warren County, 1st Ward, Indianola, page 657: Fortney, Silas M. age 54, married, born West Virginia, stone mason, Baptist

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Record â Private in Company B, 4th West Virginia Cavalry, Anna M. age 50, born West Virginia, children born Warren County, Iowa: Mae M. age 22, Bruce T. age 18, Nellie B. age 16

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Indianola Post 116, joined Dec 5, 1891, age 51, suspended 1893, dropped 1894, transferred Nov 27, 1909

FOSTER, Lyman T., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Date of Death: March 23, 1918, Place of Death: Des Moines, Iowa, Place of Burial: Norwalk Cemetery, Norwalk, Iowa, Linn Township, Warren County, Iowa, Wife: Margaret

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â His wife was a member of Crocker Relief Corps No. 27, died about 1946

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 3rd Indiana Cavalry, Company A, mustered Aug 1, 1863, mustered out Aug 7, 1865, Company A, 3rd Indiana Cavalry, reorganized of 45th Regiment

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Report of Adjutant General Indiana: Company A of 45th Regiment Indiana â reorganized, Ex-Soldiers Living in Iowa 1886: Foster, Lyman â residence Norwalk

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Des Moines Register [newspaper] March 24, 1918, page 16, section 1 â Died at his home 1727 12th Street at 5 oâclock yesterday morning.Â Survived by wife and 5 children, G.W. of Moline, Illinois, Mrs. R.D. Hatch, Mrs. J.J. Sheridan, Mrs. R.M. Hamilton and Miss Ruth Foster of Des Moines.Â Leaves also 2 brothers, one living in Kansas and one in California â Moved to Des Moines 22 years ago from Creston.Â Burial at Norwalk, Iowa

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Norwalk Post 355, joined Aug 25, 1884

FOWLER, Benjamin, GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Date of Birth: Oct 7, 1834, Place of Birth: Lexington, Perry County, Ohio, Date of Death: Aug 16, 1920, Place of Death: Indianola, Iowa, Place of Burial: I.O.O.F. Cemetery, Lincoln Township, Warren County, Iowa, Father: James F. Fowler, Mother: Sarah E., Wife: Mrs. Emily Brown

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Captain in 30th Ohio Infantry, Company D, enlisted Aug 26, 1861, age 27,Â appointed Sergeant from Private Aug 28, 1861; promoted to 2nd Lieutenant Sept 17, 1862; 1st Lieutenant Feb 29, 1864; Captain Nov 3, 1864; mustered out with Company, Aug 13, 1865, service 3 years

Battles:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â South Mountain, Maryland, Antietam, Siege of Vicksburg, Siege Jackson, Mississippi, Mission Ridge, Kennesaw Mountain, Nickajack Creek, Atlanta, Georgia, Ezra Chapel, Jonesborough

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Ex-Soldiers Living in Iowa 1886: Fowler, Benjamin â residence Indianola, Roster of Ohio Soldiers: (Benjamin)

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Personal Reminiscences Post 116: was wounded in right shoulder Bentonsville, North Carolina March 20, 1865, confined in hospital at Goldsborough, North Carolina from March 20 and at Davidâs Island, New York until April 20, 1865.Â MostÂ intimate friends were Samuel Howarth, T.J. Shepard, Wm. R. Brown, Peter Fryman, Jared Post, T.J. Alton, Wm. H. Dusenbarry, H.D. Bullock â was in every rebel state except Florida and Texas, traveled 20,000 miles. Company D had 132 men on their muster out roll, 23 men present at final discharge, 4 officers in Regiment at muster out that held commissions at organization

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Indianola Post 116, joined March 17, 1883

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â

FOX, Tilmon, GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Date of Birth: Dec 10, 1846, Wife: Bird Reese, Children: Daniel, Stella

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 34th Iowa Infantry, Company B, enlisted Feb 12, 1864, age 18, residence Warren County, Iowa, born Indiana, transferred to Company C, 34th Consolidated Battalion Nov 12, 1864,Â Â transferred to Company C, 34/38 Consolidated Battalion Jan 1, 1865.Â Mustered out Aug 15, 1865, Houston, Texas

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Roster of Iowa Soldiers: (Tilman)

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Hartford Post 169, joined May 12, 1883, age 36

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â His wife was a sister of David Reese, of same Post

FRANCIS, Alfred, GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Occupation: Farmer, Spring Hill, Warren County, Iowa, Date of Birth: 1827, Place of Birth: Erie County, New York, Date of Death: Feb 8, 1913, Place of Death: Enid, Montana, Place of Burial: Webb Cemetery, Lot 14, Grave 1, Greenfield Township, Warren County, Iowa, Father: Henry A. Francis, Mother: Louisa Hamm, Wife: (1) Amanda Ross, (2) Elizabeth Raney, Children: Capina Francis

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Corporal in 3rd Iowa Infantry, Company G, enlisted May 21, 1861, age 34, residence Green Bush, Iowa, born New York, promoted 2nd Corporal Aug 26, 1862.Â Mustered out June 18, 1864 at Davenport, Iowa

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Roster of Iowa Soldiers: Francis, Alfred, Application Paper from Post 116

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Indianola Post 116, joined July 12, 1884, age 57, reinstated Sept 30, 1888, suspended Dec 22, 1888, transferred Dec 22, 1888

FRANK, Henry H., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Date of Birth: 1845, Date of Death: Dec 13, 1887, Place of Burial: Plainville Cemetery, Belmont Township, Warren County, Iowa

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 34th Illinois Infantry, Company G, enlisted Dec 29, 1863, recruit Company D, 86th Illinois Infantry, transferred to Company G, 34th Infantry.Â Shown in Company G, 34th Illinois as recruits transferred from 86th Illinois Infantry, residence Trivoli.Â Enlisted and mustered Dec 29, 1863. Veteran record, mustered out July 12, 1865

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Adjutant Generalâs Report Illinois: Frank, Henry, Company D, 86th Infantry and Company G, 34th Illinois Infantry, Ex-Soldiers Living in Iowa 1886: Company D, 86th Illinois, residence Milo

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Milo Post 275, joined April 4, 1885

FREEL, James M. Jr., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Born: Dec 31, 1846, Â Madison County, Indiana, Died: Dec 24, 1937, Pleasantville, Iowa, Buried in Pleasantville, Iowa, Â Son of James Freel Sr. Â (born Ohio) and Mary Gwinn (born Virginia) who came to Iowa from Madison County, Indiana in 1848 and lived 58 years on the same farm (James Freel Sr. died June 8, 1906), Wife of James Freel Jr.: Martha J. Sherman

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â From the record of Orville E. Hoyt, Kamrar, IowaÂ - Family of James Freel Sr. and Mary (Gwinn) Freel: Phebe Julyana born Feb 28, 1838 died June 13, 1859, Nancy Paulina born Dec 12, 1840, Mary Hester born Aug 24, 1842, William born Aug 29, 1844 Indiana, James M. born Dec 31, 1846, Ruth Malinda born Dec 31, 1846.Â Mary Gwinn Freel, their mother, died Jan 1, 1847.

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â James Freel Sr married 2nd, Louisa Moore and their children were: Samuel born Dec 28, 1850, Benona born Oct 28, 1852, Clara Jane born March 10, 1854, Albert Newton born Dec 6, 1856, Reason Dawson born March 9, 1859, Emma born July 31, 1861, Adaline born Nov 24, 1862, Margaret born Dec 23, 1865, Eli G. born March 13, 1869

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Freel, James (father of James M., Civil War veteran) farmer, Sec. 15, P.O. Hartford; was born in Clermont County, Ohio Jan 11, 1810.Â In 1814 his parents removed to Fayette County, Indiana and afterwards to Hamilton County, where he was raised.Â He came to this county in 1848 and located where he now lives; he has been twice married; first, to Mrs. Mary Gwinn a native of Virginia, who died (at birth of twins) and a native of Virginia who died and left six children, five of whom are now living; Paulina, Hester, William, James and Malinda, and two deceased.Â He was married a second time, March 30, 1849 to Miss Louise Moore, native of Pennsylvania; they have 8 children, living, Samuel, Benoni, Albert, Reason, Emma, Adaline, Margaret and Eli; and one deceased; Clara J..Â He owns 80 acres of land, his father, Benoni was in War of 1812; his grandfather on both sides were in the Revolutionary War.Â Mary Gwinn was the widow of Alexander Gwinn, and her maiden name was also Gwinn.Â â provided by Mrs. J.G. Garton (Chariton, Iowa) and Mr. R.V. Fisher (Des Moines, Iowa)

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 34th Iowa Infantry, Company B, enlisted Jan 16, 1864, age 18, residence Warren County, Iowa, nativity Indiana, transferred to Company C, 34th Consolidated Battalion Nov 12, 1864, transferred to Company C, 34/38 Consolidated Battalion Jan 1, 1865.Â Mustered out Aug 15, 1865, Houston, Texas

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â G.A.R. Milo, Iowa, Roster of Iowa Soldiers: Freel, James M., Death Certificate J91-158

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Mrs. Nora Parks (Stephen) Robinson â Des Moines, Iowa, stepdaughter of Nancy Paulina Freel Parks, Bob Parks, son of Nancy P. Freel and James Parks who had been married before (name was Park)

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â For family history, see History of Warren County, Iowa 1879, page 702

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Iowa Census 1885 Belmont Township, Warren County, page 41; Freel, James age 38 born Indiana, Martha J. age 36 born Ohio, Cecil O. age 15 born Warren County, Iowa, Mary M. age 13 born Warren County, Iowa, James W. age 8 and Isa J., girl, age 3 born Warren County, Iowa

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Iowa Census 1895 shows above as James M., Iowa Census 1885 page 51 shows another James age 44 born Indiana and wife Mary age 40 born Indiana, children: Homer E. age 16, Samuel C. age 5 born Warren County, Iowa and Ida M. Ferguson age 1, born Warren County, Iowa

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Milo Post 275, joined Feb 2, 1884, transferred Feb 5, 1885

FREEMAN, Ira B., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Occupation: Carpenter, Date of Birth: 1834, Place of Birth: Frankford, Crawford County, Pennsylvania, Date of Death: July 3, 1914, Place of Death: Indianola, Iowa, Place of Burial: I.O.O.F. Cemetery, Indianola, Lincoln Township, Warren County, Iowa, Father: Samuel Freeman, Mother: Elizabeth Cole, Wife: (1) Isabelle, (2) Catherine Ellen Wiley, Children: Stella (A. Elmer) Spears â Indianola, Iowa, Esther Wagner â Norwalk, Iowa, born Feb 26, 1870, Mable Scroggs,- 8th Street, Des Moines, Iowa, Oren Freeman â Oregon

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 10th Kansas Infantry, Company C., enlisted Aug 9, 1861, mustered out Aug 20 or 22, 1864 at Fort Leavenworth, Kansas

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Post 116 Descriptive Book #194, Application Paper Post 116, Ex-Soldiers Living in Iowa 1886: Freeman, Ira â residence Indianola, Grave Registration lists death as June 24, 1914

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Mrs. Gertrude Lacey (daughter of Mrs. Wagner â informant re family Sept 13, 1945, Member of Tent 27 & Auxiliary 16 S.U.V. [Sons of Union Veterans of the Civil War])

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Indianola Post 116, joined 1892, age 58

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â

FRY, John S., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Born: 1845

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 33rd Indiana Infantry, Company C, enlisted Sept 16, 1861 as a veteran, residence Morgan County, Indiana, mustered out June 28, 1865

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Report of the Adjutant General Indiana, Ex-Soldiers Living in Iowa 1886: residence Milo

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Milo Post 275, joined Dec 1, 1884, suspended June 30, 1891, suspended 1892

FULLER, John W., GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Occupation: Farmer, Place of Birth: Illinois

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 92nd Illinois Infantry, Company C, enlisted Aug 6, 1862 and mustered Sept 4, 1862, residence Savanna, transferred to Invalid Corps Aug 6, 1864.Â Mustered out July 20, 1865 by General Order, served 2 years 11 months

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Adjutant Generalâs Report Illinois: (John W.), Transfer Card from Post 232, Post 116 Date mustered out

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Humansville, Missouri Post 232, cd 1897, transferred April 15, 1907

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Indianola Post 116, cd 1907, age 63

FYE, David, GAR Card File

Biographical Information:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Occupation: Minister, Date of Birth: 1845, Place of Birth: Pennsylvania, Date of Death: Feb 27, 1932, Place of Death: Marshalltown, Iowa, Place of Burial: Carlisle Cemetery, Carlisle, Iowa

War Record:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Private in 26th Illinois Infantry, Company H, enlisted Feb 28, 1865, residence Florence, Illinois, mustered out July 20, 1865

Sources:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Indianola Tribune [newspaper], A.G.R. Illinois: Fye, David

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Death Certificate shows parents Conrad, born Pennsylvania and mother, Sarah Rombarger born Pennsylvania, wife unknown

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â G.A.R. Card file shows names of father, mother, wife and children crossed off (father: James, mother: Martha Allgright, wife: Cella Ecretta Pettibone?, children: Alice Williamson â New Virginia, Iowa)

Post:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Defiance Post 304, cd Aug 13, 1886, discharged March 5, 1888

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Quincy Post 287, cd April 14, 1888, transferred Sept 18, 1888

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â St. Charles Post 158, cd 1891, suspended 1895

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Clarinda Post 11, cd Feb 2, 1898, transferred 1899, reinstated 1906

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Carlisle Post 425, Chaplain in 1922, Jan 25, 1928 paid $1.00 membership, suspended Feb 1930
